FIT Build it and they will come is an old engineering axiom Marketing communications is the vehicle to get the word out Make something that someone wants and incent them 5 Ps of marketing works

FIT Nice thought Paul Not sure how that would profitable scale given that the fitness center would want a piece of the action plus space rental insurance etc Plus the employees would they be Fitbit employeesWho would managehow Base salary plus commission 100 commission Benefits How much of trackersvc sales are needed to attract train retrain etc the right people And distribution logistics Thats a whole other business that most outsource
FIT This loves 450 That is both a good thing and a bad thing at this point Definitely deciding which way its going to go but my guess is UP

FIT I will close by saying that threelegged stools always fall over if James Park will add this fourth leg to the retail structure he will generate millions of additional sales have highly qualified employees selling his company for him and teaching users all over the world the benefits of Fitbit products

FIT this type of retail will beat Apple to the punch Apple has their retail centers in town centers all over the world currently they are not going directly to the public with their wearable products If I know Tim Cook he eventually will This idea is blatantly obvious for anyone who has mastered marketing skills

FIT these young athletic individuals could have magnetic Fitbit logos put on their vehicles and transport these kiosks to different fitness centers in their area possibly two days per week per center The key component is not just showing off the product line but explaining to fitness center users how the smartwatch will benefit their life This is fitbits biggest failure right now

FIT the kiosks should be manned by Young athletic looking professionals who have been trained by Fitbit as incentivebased entrepreneurial employees The training would be covered by Fitbit but all compensation should be incentive based on sales and finding new locations with the stock being so low its the perfect time to offer stock option based compensation to entrepreneurial employees

FIT Fitness Centers need recurring revenues just like Fitbit The incentive for them to allow a Fitbit Kiosk would be beneficial as it would bring a national corporation and wellknown brand into their center The display could be similar to those seen in Walmart or Kohls but must be transportable by van or truck

FIT Fitbits business plan is operating as a threelegged stool The legs are website sales retail sales through stores and insurance sales The fourth leg of sale should be directtoconsumer at fitness centers around the world Let me explain
FIT Would like to see commercials that show younger gen ppl showing parents grand parents the health benefits Also would like to see Drs explaining health benefits to patients

FIT Mr Parkplease discontinue the Versa lite announce a Premium smartwatch paid subscription service start advertising more possibly a celebrity endorsementand lets start heading back to the IPO PRICE of 20 already
FIT This is truly another great commercial from Fitbit Not kidding Has anyone seen it repetitively in their area Why the hell arent they blasting this thing 24 hours a day ispottvadonLlfitbitkno
FIT With a net worth of 660 million estimated by Forbes he is ranked 29 in the magazines Americas Richest Entrepreneurs Under 40 in 2015Net worth660 millionEducationHarvard College drop out
FIT quoting Gordon Gekko from the movie Wall Street If this guy James Park owned a funeral parlor no one would die

FIT continuing on earlier theme of The three stooges breaking news out of Hollywood California Reese Witherspoon approached about the upcoming remake of the movie Clueless and who she thought should Star as the lead role Witherspoon responded Without a doubt it should be James Park CEO of Fitbit There is no one I can think of more deserving of the role
